word: Work is a blessing, not a curse. Diligent labor keeps many, young and old, from the snares of him who "finds some mischief still or idle hands to do." Let no one be ashamed of work, for honest toil is ennobling. While the hands are engaged in the most common tasks, the mind may be filled with high and holy thoughts.--YI, Feb 27, 1902. (HC 223.)
